Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 6 minutes ago, benjee10 said:
> 
> 
> Shuttle-C.
> 

Please please PLEASE add this! you have no idea how many shuttle mods don't have the shuttle-C, and how much I've wanted one in a mod. Other than that, great news! I look forward to using this mod (I'm using @Daelkyr 's JOOL Direct as a place-holder for now (no offence, Daelkyr, it's a good mod, I just want benjee10's more, since it will work well in conjunction with SpaceY and SpaceY expanded))

> 
> 
> 40 minutes ago, benjee10 said:
> 
> 
> - **Spacecraft parts**, starting with a 3.75m Porkjet style **Orion** and accompanying **Altair** lander.
> - Heavy habitat parts (think modern Skylab, centrifuges etc.).
> - Various Shuttle-derivative parts, e.g. allowing building Shuttle-C.
> 

\*FAINTS AND DIES\*  

AWESOMENESS!!!!!

 I'd recommend incorporating SDHI. I love their Service module plugin.

I'd like to see the Orion and Altair first. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-14T17:43:29Z" title="04/14/2016 05:43  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 14, 2016</time> by davidy12**
This all sounds amazing. I don't really see a point to keep fiddling with my little parts pack when this baby hits prime time.

I played the STS in 1.0.5... Meh. I mean, very good work on parts (I'm in love with them, I like your style). Is it better on 1.1? Anyway SRBs contain too few fuel, they finish and decouple at a too low altidude, leaving hard work for the SSMEs (they overheat and barely reach a 100x100 orbit with no cargo). It's a pity because the model looks very good (even better if matched with Cormorant Aeronology shuttle parts). I hope you take a look on this when you have time (do not hurry).

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-15T15:21:42Z" title="04/15/2016 03:21  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 15, 2016</time> by trooperMNG**

> 
>

> 
> 
> I played the STS in 1.0.5... Meh. I mean, very good work on parts (I'm in love with them, I like your style). Is it better on 1.1? Anyway SRBs contain too few fuel, they finish and decouple at a too low altidude, leaving hard work for the SSMEs (they overheat and barely reach a 100x100 orbit with no cargo). It's a pity because the model looks very good (even better if matched with Cormorant Aeronology shuttle parts). I hope you take a look on this when you have time (do not hurry).
> 

I do agree that SRB burn out is too soon, think perhaps using 2 meter or 2.5 meter SRBs that could be made when benjee revamps textures/remakes them. However, even with SRB burn out, I was still able to deliver a HabTech Unity Module into orbit.

Maybe you could collab with him ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Also, [@benjee10](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/84110-benjee10/), for the SRB's can you add a gimbal on it? I can't make a good Ares I without it.
Forgot to ask, will you be making the RS-68s that I believe also would have flown for this?

> Forgot to ask, will you be making the RS-68s that I believe also would have flown for this?

I believe they were only for the earlier DIRECT proposals, v3.0 switched to SSMEs. I believe Nertea's Cryogenic Engines mod has a decent analogue anyway. 

> 
> 
> On 15 April 2016 at 5:03 AM, Daelkyr said:
> 
> 
> This all sounds amazing. I don't really see a point to keep fiddling with my little parts pack when this baby hits prime time.
> 

They fill different niches! Yours is in keeping with the stock sizing more (based around the stock SLS parts). You're welcome to keep using textures from here as they get updated if you like too!

![O4vAMRI.png](http://i.imgur.com/O4vAMRI.png)

![PvIZkfA.png](http://i.imgur.com/PvIZkfA.png)

WIP better tank textures. The nose cones and end caps for the orange tanks will get their own texture sheet as well because reusing textures from this set looks bad on them.

Next up is SRBs!

> 
>

Lookin' GORGEOUS!!! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Can't wait for the SRBs. 

PS: Can you make the orange tank have the option of LF+O/LH+O

> 
> 
> 35 minutes ago, davidy12 said:
> 
> 
> Lookin' GORGEOUS!!! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Cheers!

The idea is that the orange tanks contain LH+O while the black & white ones contain LF+O.

Normal maps & specular in game:

![NdPeHEA.png](http://i.imgur.com/NdPeHEA.png)

![M3RYFuX.png](http://i.imgur.com/M3RYFuX.png)
The white tanks should have the option to switch,  so we can use Nerteas cryogenic engines in upperstages.

[@benjee10](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/84110-benjee10/): I just don't use RF or LH2 that often.

I'm going to keep things as they are for the time being (balance pending). 

Redone external tank:

![CF4OLEH.png](http://i.imgur.com/CF4OLEH.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-29T00:24:20Z" title="04/29/2016 12:24  AM" data-short="8 yr">April 29, 2016</time> by benjee10**
Looks good! Any hope of preliminary release?

> 
> 
> Just now, Gryphorim said:
> 
> 
> Looks good! Any hope of preliminary release?
> 

Soon, but not too soon. The redone parts are pretty much ready and Orion is in game but needs at least a temporary IVA, and then other stuff to allow it to be usable (LES & cover, Service module bits) but I'm pretty busy IRL so dev is pretty slow. Targeting some time in May I would think.

> 
> 
> 12 minutes ago, benjee10 said:
> 
> 
> [![aFzHw06.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/aFzHw06.png?1)](http://i.imgur.com/aFzHw06.png?1 "Enlarge image")
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 3.75m Orion pod.
> 

The forward facing windows seem a little large, but who am I to judge? The best I can model is an engine bell and I haven't even taken a shot at texturing.

> 
> 
> 10 minutes ago, Sgt.Shutesie said:
> 
> 
> The forward facing windows seem a little large, but who am I to judge? The best I can model is an engine bell and I haven't even taken a shot at texturing.
> 

They're definitely oversized but I like IVAs with big windows and big views ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") 

Also fits with the idea that it's a derivative from both the mk3 and the mk1-2 pod (it's called the mk1-3 in game) as there seems to be a trend of larger windows as the tech tree progresses.

Had some chance today to block out the Altair lander (sans landing gear). I'll be going for the horizontal cylinder configuration of the earlier visualisations rather than the vertical cylinder of newer ones (because it looks more interesting IMO).

![qagudD2.png](http://i.imgur.com/qagudD2.png)

Six fuel tanks in the descent stage with two gaps where there will be places to attach stuff like science equipment or KIS containers. 

![OJ6b2bg.png](http://i.imgur.com/OJ6b2bg.png)

The IVA will be laid out something like this, with a pilot at the front and then three kerbals in the back. 

![jaIqo1i.png](http://i.imgur.com/jaIqo1i.png)

Close-up of the ascent stage. Diameter is 1.25m, top attach node is 0.9375m. I'm thinking the engine should be larger and be monoprop fuelled, perhaps even 1.25m in diameter to work as a Shuttle OMS engine as well. Still undecided whether to make a custom descent stage engine or just allow clustering of other engines (maybe the ascent stage engine?)

Wow! You are *really, really* fast! I can't wait for release! (or the next one, whichever contains your new beautiful models and textures). I never used the old one because it wasn't porkalike enough to me.
